verse.roman:
tataḥ kūṭam anuprāptaṁ
rāmaḥ praharatāṁ varaḥ
avadhīl līlayā rājan
sāvajñaṁ vāma-muṣṭinā

synonyms: tataḥ—then; kūṭam—the demonic wrestler Kūṭa; anuprāptam—appearing on the scene; rāmaḥ—Lord Balarāma; praharatām—of fighters; varaḥ—the best; avadhīt—killed; līlayā—playfully; rājan—O King, Parīkṣit; sa-avajñam—neglectfully; vāma—left; muṣṭinā—with His fist.
translation: Confronted next by the wrestler Kūṭa, Lord Balarāma, the best of fighters, playfully and nonchalantly killed him with His left fist, O King.
